creator: tschlabach@gmx.net
text:
In the latest RC4/RC5 the tomcat.webapps.dir property in build.properties seems
to have changed from a relative path (relative to tomcat.home.dir) to an
absolute path.

This is not a problem as such but the comment above should be changed.

This affects src/targets/test-build.xml which expects tomcat.webapps to be relative

eg.
 <property name="test.pub.dir"
value="${tomcat.home.dir}/${tomcat.webapps.dir}/lenya/pubs/${test.pub.id}"/>

need to either:
- revert back to relative path
or
- update all references to account for the change
creator: ps@nomensa.com
gregor@apache.org
text: there were some changes in that area, can you retest?

creator: nettings@apache.org
text:
tomcat.webapps.dir is defined in build.properties. by default, it is relative to
tomcat.home.dir, but that is perfectly obvious, correctly commented and can be
changed easily.
